result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marc Thomas Seay

8:30 AM Defendant Marc Thomas Seay appeared by video from Olmsted County jail, in custody. Prosecuting attorney Jeffrey Lawrence Kemp in court for the State of Wisconsin. RL-clerk. Def indicates he is trying to go into a treatment program. DA Kemp does not oppose a sig bond. Def indicates he is homeless and does not have a mailing address. CT does not quash warrant. CT addresses defendant. Def gives another mailing address of 241 Summit Park Drive St. Peter MN 56082. Def indicates he will be able to receive mail there. Def states he will be in treatment program for 90 days. Def waives reading of CC. DA requests sig bond. CT sets bond. CT quashes warrant. 8:36 am adj.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
